name: Luxor Las Vegas

reviews.text: We stayed at Luxor for 2 nights and really didnt have any complaints. Altho we didnt win in the casino, our pyramid room with jacuzzi tub under the window was great, view was amazing. The buffet was above average. The decor and ambiance was unique and entertaining. The only drawback was that you could only get to your room by one specific inclinator, and you had to pass a guard & show your room key to get on it. (they werent consistantly friendly...) So if theres two of you & you only take one key, deciding to meet at the room, youre out of luck, because you cant get on the inclinator without it.
reviews.title: Neat experience

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luxor Mar 2-6th. It's a beautiful place and we had no complaints. We arrived from the airport via taxi which cost about $8. Our check-in was very efficient with little or no waiting. We had our choice between the pyramid or one of the towers. The desk clerk said they liked the west tower best because it was recently renovated. We decided to try it. It was a pretty long walk to the elevator, but we had been sitting all day so were ready to walk some. The room, to our surprise, was very beautiful The bathroom was alot of marble and gold fixtures with a seperate tub and shower. The color scheme was very rich and warm. The window took up practically the whole wall. We could see just a corner of the start of the strip, but we did'nt come to Vegas to look out the window. We decided to try our the casino that evening after walking conveniently over the the Excalibar. We did'nt have much luck. The machines seemed to loosen up on the weekend. I lost $300 the first night. It was hard getting on a BJ table too. They were always full and the only one's with seats were the higher limit. The cocktail waitress's were around alot and fairly punctual with drinks. They were friendly too.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel
Loved the Luxor
reviews.text: We breakfast twice at the Pharoah's Buffet. It was absolutely great! I think my fiance went to bed early at night just to get up early enough to eat here. There is absolutely everything you can think of for breakfast. For $10 we would stuff ourselves and not really have to eat another meal all day. I wish we would have tried some other buffets like at Mandalay Bay, but we really thought the Luxor's was about as good as you could get.

Our housekeeper kept our room clean and tidy and never seemed to bother us in the mornings. We would leave and come back to a clean room. One thing that sticks in my head about our room is the beautiful light fixtures and cleaver theme related artwork all in the halls and our room.
reviews.title: Could have been better
I Loved Vegas so the hotel did not really matter....BUT..
reviews.text: Check-out was'nt too bad. We had to wait maybe 5 min. in line. Don't use the phone in the room. It cost $2 everytime you call a number, even if it's using a phone card or 800 number. That was all the charges we had for our room. We caught a cab and were off to the airport. Good bye for now Vegas. We'll be back to get our money some other time. Thanks for a good time!

We travelled to vegas for a convention, and had booked the luxor 7 months in advance. Got a terrific rate and some great discount coupons. When we arrived and saw the lineups for checkin we were immediately terrified as we were travelling with our children but to our delight the lines moved quickly and within 20 min we were in our east tower room. The room was clean and cool. With temperatures reaching well over 100 degrees airconditioning was a must. The rooms were made up early everyday. Found the staff to be very friendly and when we asked for extra blankets and towels they were eager to please and were there immediately. The one major complaint was the pool. It closed too early. With the high temperatures my kids didn't want to be out in the pool until after dinner but that was too late as they closed at 7:00pm. as well 2 of the pools were closed.
reviews.title: first time at the luxor

reviews.text: We found getting around to the nearby hotels easy once you figured out the tram and bus system.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: Would maybe stay there again but might look at the Mandalay bay as it had a better pool.
reviews.title: Luxor is great

reviews.text: Booked a non smoking room for 1 night in advance, checked in by a very miserable man that didnt even look at us when he was speaking, he preferred to chat to the girl on the next desk than us.
reviews.title: Not Bad For Price
Great place for a long weekend
reviews.text: We planned to stay in Vegas for 4 nights after a long drive from Yosemite and enquired on the rate for the next 3 nights he told us it was 69$ and just to come back after we had looked at the room.

I stayed at the Luxor with some girlfriends from August 18-20. It wasn't a bad hotel but I wouldn't stay again since there are better ones in Vegas. What you find inside the Luxor is pretty awesome, you find yourself in a mini city and the view from above the lobby is beautiful.
reviews.title: With so many hotels in Vegas, why stay here?

likes.liked: — good price on the hotel through Orbitz
likes.disliked: — AC was not strong enough, on the far end of the Strip, not enough selection for food in the hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean and spacious enough although it was a bit dark in the bathroom and bedroom. No good lighting for makeup application. My one big complaint about our room was that the AC wasn't working hard enough. At first we thought it was broken but after feeling the cold air was blowing out and smelling a burning smell near the window on the slanted celing of the window (we were on the 13th floor), we realized the sun was so strong and hot, it was affecting the temperature of the room! Luxor either needs to find some way to cool down the room or block the heat of the sun. At night, the room was cool enough but in the morning and during the day the room was uncomfortable in the summer. We ate at the Pharoh's Cafe one morning and the food was tasty and the portions were big. The menu selection was very limited though. We also ate at the buffet in the hotel for breakfast but since we got there late, we were also able to try dinner as well. The food and selection were below average compared to other hotel buffets but what can you really expect for $12-14 (breakfast and lunch respectively)? We didn't have time to gamble since were busy with bachelorette plans during the weekend so I can't comment on the casino.
reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE $$, RATHER STAY @ MOTEL 6

likes.liked: — The business meeting that I went to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had to fight to get a non-smoking room, which we had booked/prepaid!!! and our room still smelled like smoke. Rooms are like a bad motel 6. No pens to write with, no free internet/gym ANYTHING! Pools are all shallow and open to anyone, no lap/adult only pool. Everything is extra! And expensive! No good restaurants/shops in hotel, tears in sheets, "Inclinators" are neat, but a pain....
reviews.title: expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ONLY GOOD remark I have, is, the staff were ALL friendly.
reviews.title: Not worthy of the 4 star rating.
Oh dear - not what expected
reviews.text: Would NEVER stay there again/nor recommend it!

reviews.title: scammed
reviews.text: I found myself making a big mistake assuming that by staying at the Luxor and gambling as one of its Player club members I might be the recipient of comp's.

I spent 8 nights at this hotel and put alot of time on the tables. During the stay staff told me how my play afforded me comp's like a free night or meals for two. On checking out this all conveniently dissappeared off their system. The best bit is when you check out, the hotels computer system operates on a different system so they can't/wont help you with player ratings etc. You need to go and line up for about an hour at the player club and even then no one wants to help. They play a time waisting game as they know when your checking out it means your on your way to catch a plane. I've been to Vegas before and received much better service and comps for my loyalty. If you stay there do not waist your time playing there. Your much better off gambling in another place.
reviews.title: Nice, but stingy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luxor is a nice hotel: Clean, relatively efficient, and contains all the usual Las Vegas casinos, etc.
reviews.title: The Luxor is OK for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is not extremely convenient, as it is located on the south side of the strip.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for the Price

reviews.text: However, it is stingy: There are no coffee facilities in the room, every use of the business center is $7, etc.
reviews.title: Not the best
Birthday Visit to the Luxor
reviews.text: First time visit and had booked it online 2 months ago as a Birthday Treat. Arrived on 18/2/04 at about 7pm. No problems with checking in, and room good,but I think not having coffee making facilities in the room is a mistake. We tried the Pyramid Cafe and the Buffett which was good, but did eat at other places in particular the champagne brunch at the Hilton which is good value. Overall a great holiday and the Luxor is a good place to stay and we would stay there again.

reviews.title: Dirty, Crowded, Ineffecient Staff. Did I Mention Dirty???
reviews.text: August 2003: If you value your decency, don't stay here. We checked in at 5pm (late for a check-in) and they said our rooms were "being cleaned". We had to wait in the lobby for over one hour while our rooms were being "cleaned" after travelling in a hot car for over 6 hours.

reviews.title: Luxor-Great Value
reviews.text: Horrible front desk, and i never saw the lines less than 10 people deep.

reviews.title: Shabby
reviews.text: Once we finally got upstairs, we had to switch rooms twice during our stay because of cigarette smoke leeching through the walls and through the bathroom vent twice. The staff assured us the floors were were on were non-smoking, but basically insinuated that people will smoke cigarettes in non-smoking rooms, and there's nothing they can do about it. There is not enough staff to work in a place so big. Whe we checked out, we waited over 20 minutes for a bell boy, and finally cancelled it and brought down the bags ourself. This not good when you are flying out of the airport. Just extremely frustrating.

reviews.title: Great stay at Luxor
reviews.text: The pyramid was the most filthy place i've ever stayed. I witnessed an empty beer bottle in the hallway that stayed there for 3 days. No one from housekeeping ever picked it up. The elevators were always filthy with garbage in the corners and fingerprints/faceprints all over the mirrors. The rooms were just disgusting. I found dirt and hair by the pillow on my bedding the first night, which was not mine. The pyramid rooms all have water damage, too, at the windows. And the rooms are very dark during the day because the windows are tinted dark.

reviews.title: Very Good Experience
reviews.text: My fiance and I just got back from 3 days at the Luxor. Unlike some other reviewers, we had no problem checking in - with 3 people ahead of us, it took less than 10 minutes. The hotel is big, but with the map they give you at check-in and the signs throughout the hotel, we didn't have much trouble finding our way around. We stayed in a tower room and found the room to be neat and a good value for the money. The buffet was also a really good value with a good variety of delicious and fresh choices. The only downside was that, as another reviewer mentioned, the water pressure left a lot to be desired. But overall we liked the Luxor so much that we chose it for the location of our wedding this fall.

reviews.title: The place has a bad vibe, especially the card tables.
reviews.text: I stayed at the Luxor b/c of the rates, but personally I would have rather stayed somewhere else, even downtown then this place. Mainly b/c the dealers had no sense of humor no were they friendly (with the exception of one.) If you hate the feeling your in a tomb, stay away from this place, b/c the interior walls give you that feeling your in a bottomless pit. Trust me the odds playing at that casino vs. others is shameful. My advice, go elsewhere, b/c if you want atmosphere try the NY NY casino. I would also rate the Tower rooms as average, with roomy bathrooms, b/c they offer a seperate garden tub and shower.

reviews.title: Nothing to complain about here...
reviews.text: Well, after reading all of the reviews on here for months before my own trip, I just had to write my own....a little long, but bear with me. I put a great deal of importance on where I stay (even though in Vegas you really don't spend a lot of time in your room!), so I was kind of wary about the Luxor based on the many negative reviews I'd read these past 3 months. Needless to say, I was not disappointed. We were able to secure a great rate for the 3 nights we stayed ($59/nt), and when the rates online dropped, they dropped our rate accordingly to $49/night!!

reviews.title: Luxor check in bad
reviews.text: You really can't beat that! I can't comment on check-in waits however, because the couple we were meeting there were able to check into our room for us, having arrived a few hours ahead. This was great as we arrived from the airport and were able to go straight to our room after meeting them. They did say that there was no wait at all for them. (TIP though....try checking into the NORTH lobby...that's where our taxi driver dropped us off....it was completely deserted at 4:00pm) Anyway...our room was on the 26th floor (as we'd requested a higher room) and the views were spectacular. We were right in the middle of the giant sphinx outside, overlooking the strip and the airport. It was extremely quiet, clean, very roomy and the service good. I loved the huge glassed-in shower (who needs a bath in Vegas??), although the water pressure left a little to be desired. (most hotels have crappy pressure, so it's nothing we're not used to anyway). We loved all our meals that we ate there....La Salsa, the Pyramid cafe and the buffet.

We did lunch at the buffet and was a great deal at $10.50 pp. We all did fairly well on the slots here too...much better than anywhere else on the strip this trip anyway. DO SEE THE BLUE MAN GROUP!!! It was fantastic! (Unless you have a problem with lots of loud noise) Can't even describe just what it is....a treat for your eyes, ears and your mind! Very much worth the ticket priced I'd say. And finally, as for the location of the Luxor?? Please...stop your whining! If you're going to Vegas and want to see every casino on the strip, you're in for some walking anyway! If that end of the strip doesn't interest you, then don't stay there! We walked (and cabbed and took a limo one night!) all the way past Caesars and saw a lot. (Which reminds me, the Fremont Street experience is neat, but not worth making a separate trip for....our limo driver took us down there and dropped us off for about 15 mins or so...enough to take in the light show and look around, then head back to the strip). This was our second trip to Las Vegas and was much better than our first!! (when we stayed at the Flamingo....ugghh AWFUL...another story lol) For our 3rd trip??? I'd definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Run Down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the spa suite for 5 nights last year. The Luxor is fantastic, its cheaper than a lot of the hotels, but just GREAT value for money. Pool is lovely, staff are lovely, the room was HUGE and amazing esp with the jacuzzi in the corner. The casino had a 'homely' feel to it and the dealers were all so nice. I can't fault the Luxor!
reviews.title: I love Luxor!

reviews.text: Ok, first let's start with the c/n the reception was no very nice , did not even smile, they charged us a resort fee 79$ that we did not know about when making the reservation on line. Second , the room is very very bad it's just a bed' not even wifi in the room. The bathroom towel smells very bad. The overall is never again I will come to this hotel.
reviews.title: Never again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading reviews about the luxor we were not sure what to expect. My wife and I were there for our honeymoon and were very surprised to what we encountered. From the time we got there to the time we left luxor and the staff were very amazing. The staff was nice and polite and made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay. The Rooms (Spa Suite) was outstanding. The bed was amazing, very comfortable. The gambling didn't go as expected but its gambling. The MLife is a great service they also get two thumbs up. The food was great and plentiful. We never had a bad moment. As far as the time share people just ignore them if you are not into that type of thing, they only hound you if you stop and talk to them. The luxor is a very nice and enjoyable hotel and casino. Thanks for the memories.
reviews.title: Amazing Amazing Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Luxor is a cool looking hotel when you drive by on the strip. Keep driving.
reviews.title: Don't do it

reviews.text: Dirty room
reviews.title: Hotel amazing! But Beaware
Good Choice for the Money
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights at the Luxor in early March in the east tower. The room was quite large although the bathroom was average size. The decor was nice and the cleaning staff seemed to do a thorough job. The layout of the whole place is a little tricky but the walking distances are no worse then any of the other giant resorts in town. The room walls are definitely a little thin as mentioned in other reviews. It wasn't a problem for us as we were at the end of the hall and didn't have any noisy neighbors, but I could see it being a problem if you were near the elevators or had some partiers nearby. The pool area was decent.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, but noisy!
reviews.text: Not as ornate as some others in town, but better then you will find at the average hotel. Given the 4400 rooms, I have to believe it gets pretty crowded during the prime season. Spa/fitness room was okay, although its still $20 even if you just want to work out for an hour.

reviews.title: We will keep going back for more
reviews.text: Buffett was quite good and less expensive then many on the strip. The Mexican restaurant is a local chain that you find at several locations on or near the strip and was lousy. Food court offers some quick, inexpensive options. Location is at the south end of the strip so expect some walking or cab fares if you want to see all the other hotels and attractions. All in all, I wouldn't pay an arm and a leg to stay here but we were generally satisfied and the rates usually seem reasonable. Feel free to email me with any questions.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I loved the Luxor but were very disappointed with how much we could hear through the walls. At 2:00 a.m., we had a group on one side of our room who were fighting and yelling - then proceeded to take a shower and sing at the top of their lungs. The other side of our room was a couple who apparently kept their TV on all night and day. It was terrible. We asked for a room change the next day and were accomodated with a room with no adjoining door. It made a big difference. Other than the noise, we loved the hotel and would stay there again, except we'd make sure we did not have an adjoining door in the room again.

reviews.title: Nasty!
reviews.text: The Luxor is an excellent hotel - We made our 1st trip to Vegas in September 2003 we are going back again in May 2004 - we will keep going back too. The luxor has lovely rooms, excelent pool, the staff are friendly and helpful. we loved it !!

I was really doubtful after reading the latest reviews on trip advisor, but it really wasn't THAT bad! Last year I stayed at the luxury of the Ballagio, but I was realistic about the fact that the Luxor was going to be a lot different.
reviews.title: Really not as bad as some reviews on here say...

likes.disliked: — in need of an update and lack of egyptian attractions

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHECK IN/ CHECK OUT
reviews.title: Great price for an ideal 'different' hotel

reviews.text: We checked in at 17.00 and there was a small queue which went down very quickly. Check out was even easier as the room was pre-paid and we hadn't charged anything to the room so we just had to pop the key card in a bow and that was it! super easy and fast.
reviews.title: Hotel in a sad state

reviews.text: TOUTS
reviews.title: First time in Vegas.... ok hotel but wouldnt stay again

likes.liked: — quirky feel of being in a pyramid
likes.disliked: — rude staff and awfull timeshare people

reviews.title: Ok if you don't expect any service
reviews.text: In the 5 days we were there we were hassled by NO touts trying to sell us things. The people I saw selling things we pleasent enough and didn't seem pushy. You just need to be strong willed and say "no thanks" if they approach you.

I stayed at the Luxor Feb 18-19. I had a pyramid room and liked it. It's an average size room: 2 queen beds, a desk area, bathroom with large shower. It didn't feel crowded at all. The view was beautiful. (14th floor) Room was very clean and quiet. I slept well, and would definately stay here again.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Luxor March 2 - 5, 2005 and let me start by saying that overall the hotel was really nice. The decorations, artwork, statues were beautiful. We had a spa suite in the pyramid that was really nice as well. My only complaints were that the jets in the spa hardly worked and there was also alot of light that came in under and around the door - kinda made it hard to sleep. My only real complaint about the hotel (all of the hotels really) was that everything was very hard to find - even with the maps. Of course, I realize that this is probably not an accident since they want you feeding those machines as much as possible but it did start to irritate me after while. Anyway, that being said, we thought the breakfast buffet was pretty good; we ate breakfast at the Pyramid Cafe once and it was really good; La Salsa (mexican food) was decent; Cafe Giorgio over in Mandalay Place was nice. We caught once of the IMAX films and that was pretty neat. So, overall, it is a really nice hotel. I don't know that we would stay there again but that's only because I would rather stay someplace different each time.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We just go back from a two night stay at the Luxor (we spent 3 more nights at the Stratosphere). All in all, we had an excellent experience all around and everything was great. We had a Pyramid room (which I highly recommend) and loved every minute of it. The service was oustanding, the casino was laid out very well and the other attractions were enough to keep us occupied without ever having to leave the hotel. If you want to leave, there is a monorail that connects it to the Excalibur and Mandaly Bay and also connects to the corner of Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd. which is where New York New York is at as well as the MGM Grand. We will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.
Amazing hotel with bland rooms.
reviews.text: For the most part, the Luxor is an absolutly amazing hotel. I felt like I was in an Egyptian Temple. The public areas - the lobby with its statues and art and exhibits were fantastic, absolutly amazing. The casino was great - I won $350.00. But, the rooms were very bland and the hallways were somewhat run down. I think that they don't want people spending too much time in thier rooms, so I think that they make the rooms bland on purpose. My room was in the Pyrmad (which I definitly reccomend) and I had an awsome view of the city and the Sphinx. It was clean, but it was a very ordinary hotel room. The all-you can-eat buffet was fair, so I would reccomend eating somewhere else. The shops in the Luxor were very nice, but very very very expensive.

reviews.title: We liked it!
reviews.text: In all, I would definitly reccomend the Luxor, especally if you love Egyptian art - like I do. I am really looking forward to going back to the Luxor.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent just one night in Vegas, and we were honestly just looking for a good deal on The Strip. The price was definitely right; however, if we make a return trip, I would like to stay in a more centrally located hotel. (For those who don't know, the Luxor is located at one end of The Strip, across from the airport.) The hotel itself is lavish, with the decor adhering to the Egyptian theme. Our very standard room was quite spacious and clean, as was the bathroom.
reviews.title: Great value! Convenience is lacking.

reviews.text: The Luxor fit our needs for one night in Vegas. My only complaint was that the walk from the parking structure to the reception area led us through much of the casino. Pulling suitcases through the casino crowd was a bit of a challenge, as well as an annoyance. The less bags you have, the better.
reviews.title: Will not choose it again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The drawbacks:
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room I got had a dirty floor. When I called the concerned department, they said someone would come but none came and after half an hour I had to go down to the front desk to complain and it was only then that the Manager came up to see it,, though to their credit, they had changed the room as soon as I complained and before the manager came.
reviews.title: Avarage Hotel, fantastic location, amazing experience

reviews.text: The internet was not working and again it took quiet some time before the person came to set it right.
reviews.title: Best pillows ever - other reviewer is nuts

reviews.text: It is very good value for money, if you get the MVP offer (found on their website). The Pyramid rooms are very dated and so the newer Tower rooms are the best bet. They are nice rooms, but the casino and restaurant are in need of some work. The casino is very smokey and the stale smell is not pleasant. We tried the LAX nightclub - but it was awful! I am just glad it was free to guests. The Luxor is at the end of the strip, so you have a bit of a walk to get to the action - especially as you are forced to walk through various casinos, shops and walkways to get anywhere. Overall, it is a good cheap option, but does have some faults.
reviews.title: Needs updating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the budget I had planned it was a choice between the luxor, excaliber and circus circus... and i made the right choice. Room was lovely and an offer of an upgraded room for 300 dollars for the week was nice (would have cost a lot more through the travel agent)
reviews.title: Good Rate, Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good also had a choice of the stratosphere hotel to stay which by comparisson is out in the wilderness, the steak house there is nice but so was the bill but lots of budget food places in the hotel aswel.
reviews.title: Good Stay

likes.disliked: — Hey Guy's do you want tickets? :-S

reviews.text: nightclub was lively in the hotel but didnt care to much for the shows on at the time i was there
reviews.title: Stayed there on 12/7-12/11 2008

likes.disliked: — Nothing to do in the hotel other than gambling & Criss Angel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: cant go wrong with this hotel
reviews.title: Lived Up To My Expectations

likes.liked: — Large Jacuzzi Room / Quirky, Fun, Unique
likes.disliked: — Thin walls (Noisy Neighbors) / Tattered Carpet / Lighting A Little Dim

reviews.title: Three Rooms in 24 hours!
reviews.text: We were diverted at check in to a time share counter and then no rooms were available in the Pyramid. Tower room the first night, Pyramid room the next morning with sewage problems and corner suite later that afternoon. Hairspray was wonderful but pure agony the first 24 hours.

Stayed for one night of luxury after spending the previous few weeks staying in budget accommodation around California. Booked a spa suite, which was very spacious, the bedroom was very big and had a separate lounge area, with two television sets and a hot tub overlooking the pool area. The beds were very comfortable and bathroom very clean. The room could have done with being updated slightly, the wallpaper was peeling around the hot tub, however overall it was great.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: Pool area was nice, however there was very little shade, which is essential for June heat, and a couple of pools were closed. Check out was quick, we used the drop-off service where you return the keys with some details, and do not have to queue. One thing that was annoying was the distance you have to walk around the casino floor with your luggage to get to the hotel room - this is the same for probably all of the hotels, but nevertheless still fustrating!
reviews.title: Your average hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Luxor in June fro only about $70/night. I would not pay much more to stay there. It was ok, but it was quite far down the strip and the hotel is definitely aging. The rooms were about as plain as they could be. It was all very clean and no problems but nothing really great either. We rented a cabana for a day at the pool and that was nice, but a little pricey for what you get. $175 gets you your own private cabana, a waitress, 2 rafts, and unlimited supply of juice and water. Unless you spend the entire day at the pool is doesn't seem worth it. The casino was big and they had lots of variety for gambling, the buffet is good for the price but you can get better. The hallway outside the room was cool because you could look out over the whole hotel. If you just want a nice place to stay that's not too expensive then the Luxor is your kind of hotel, if your looking for luxury look somewhere else.
reviews.title: Shabby and Unkempt

reviews.text: After a long drive to Las Vegas we joined the long queue at check in for the Luxor, we had to dodge the time-share salespersons lurking in the foyer and find our way through a maze of slots to the elevator. Our room was on the third level, it looked worn and tired. There was a pane of glass in the sloping window which was cracked through and repaired with sellotape, another pane had a greasy mark from someones pomade pressing against it as they took in the view of the construction site outside. The shower stall leaked all over the floor, there was no bath as promised at reception, "All our rooms have baths!" there was a black moldering crusted stain at the base of the toilet, I think it was vomit from the previous occupant which had not been cleaned properly. We reported this to houskeeping who cleaned up while we were out. The rest of the room was clean enough, though the carpet was worn and there were cigarette burns on the table (in a non-smoking room). Two og the restaurants advertised on the web site are no longer operating, the cafe in the gaming lounge had good food at reaonable prices. Luxor left us underwhelmed at the Vegas experience.
reviews.title: Little details missing not worth the money

reviews.text: We spent 2 nights at the Luxors West Tower around the end of June 2006, booked through the Luxor-homepage and enjoyed every minute of it. The room on the 3rd floor was spacious, in a surprisingly good condition, tidy and well furnished (good bed). Check-in meant standing in lines, but that's what you expect from a hotel this size. Having an accomodation in walking-distance to most attractions of the new Strip (for example the excelent buffet in the Mandalay) was a great advantage.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Only disappointment: The outline of the pool area is quite simple - compared to the offers of the neighboring hotels - and opening hours were too short (9 a.m. to 7 p.m.).
reviews.title: Wonderful Luxor!

reviews.text: Revisiting Las Vegas, we would stay at the Luxor again.
reviews.title: Old Luxor
No Problems!
reviews.text: We've just got back from a five night break at the Luxor. We were lucky enough to be upgraded (free of charge!) to a suite in the East Tower. The room was fantastic - we couldn't ask for more. The shower and jacuzzi were lovely, and it was nice to have a double sink. The room was spotlessly clean (and I can usually find the smallest piece of dirt) and the air conditioning worked perfectly, making the room a great place to escape the Vegas heat.

Check-in had a long queue, but it moves fast due to the number of staff working. Checking out is simple using the TV - I still don't understand why everyone else decided to stand in a long queue instead of checking out this way. All the staff we met (with the exception of one roulette croupier) were friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Go with a Spa Suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spent a weekend in the Luxor and really felt well cared for! The rooms were large and beautifully decorated, the bathroom the largest i've seen in a US hotel!! The building itself is amazing, and houses an Imax cinema the kids will love, and the Tutenkhamun exhibition., along with a theatre and of course the casino. Surrounded by gardens and stuffed full of egyptian architecture and statues guest rooms are offered in the pyramid but we paid a small supplement, $30, and up graded to a tower room. There is a fabulous pool complex for guest use and a spa if you really feel like splashing out. The hotel joins via walkways to the Mandalay Bay and Excalibur Hotels so you can easily move from one to the other (and onto the mian strip) and use the facilities and entertainments. (Excalibur has a great kids midway area with $1 games). It is well situated on the strip, in fact its most noteable when you land at the airport, being right opposite you really cant miss it, yet there was no disturbance from aircraft noise. There are a variety of cafes and resturants, along with the buffet but you wont find the likes of MacDonalds here, and consequently the prices reflect the better quality hotel. A great place if you want to have a treat!!
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, some friends and I stayed at the Luxor for 4nights at the end of march. Our friends had been there before and wanted to return so we booked there to be with them. After reading reviews here on TA I was not sure about the place and was ready for the worst. Well it turned out to be a great trip and the hotel was fine. We arrived on a Monday around 11am line was not terrible waited about 10-15minutes. We were checked in by a pleasant woman. We reserved a standard pyramid room for around $415 for the four nights. The clerked offered us an upgrade to suite for $70 more per night which we declined. Our rooms were together with friends as requested non smoking. (the room did not smell like smoke). It was a standard hotel room clean and comfortable but very far from the inclinator (which was very nauseating to ride for me). My friend has bad knee and requested something closer to elevated so we moved to a tower room (no extra charge ) the next day. The tower room was newer a little brighter (not much) and closer to elevator. We were happy with the move but honestly would not want to pay extra for this room. The only problem I had with the move was we had to wait for bellhop (who had the keys to new room) for around one and half hours. That was result of poor communication between front desk and bellhop desk. I complained to a manager and got a genuine apology. The casino was fun, drink service good, very dark as others have said but not real Smokey. My husband did great in the casino and we got everything on our bill comped. Sat by the pool for a day, quite pool scene but nice( no drink service had to get up and go to bar also no adult only pool opened). Had a great massage and spent afternoon in spa. The spa is nice not the best but nice enough. Sauna, steam room (eucalyptus) and whirlpool. Nice robes and shoes given out. Plenty of drinks and fruit around (try the green tea infused water at desk very good) Did not try any of the restaurants (the steak house was closed) except the regular café which served good breakfast but service was slow. We ate out of the hotel every night for dinner. Here’s the thing about luxor, it is way at the beginning of strip so if you plan on walking the strip it is not convenient. Last time we were there we stayed at the planet Hollywood (it was the Aladdin back then). It is better to stay central when you plan on doing a lot of walking. I walked everyday and its out of the way. Other then that the hotel was fine for the price. Rooms are fine its not the Wynn but you get what you pay for folks.
reviews.title: Good Stay At Luxor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 5 nights at the Luxor. check in took a while, but I already knew that.
reviews.title: Pyramid rooms a bit shabby

likes.disliked: — Being hassled to purchase tickets to show etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont get bailed up by people trying to sell you tickets to shows
reviews.title: Always a great value and nice rooms

reviews.text: Thanks to the other reweiws I already knew about this.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: First trip to Vegas and first impression was not good. What hits you is the smell of smoke everywhere. We were greeted by what we thought was someone from check-in only to discover they were selling tickets to the shows and attractions. we quickly left and joined what I thought was a long queue. It moved fairly quickly and we were asked if we'd like an upgrade for $30 a night. Glad we did. Nice big room, a bit dated and in need of an upgrade but fine. The long queue we experienced was nothing, at times it was like being at the airport.
reviews.title: New Year

reviews.text: Once we found our feet, Vegas is so over the top its unbelievable. A must see place even if it's only once. We preferred down at Caesars Palace and the shops, restaurants and attractions at this end of the Strip.
reviews.title: Tired, a disappointment

likes.disliked: — The lack of TLC given to what I'm sure once was a great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The smoking and drinking in public areas and on the Strip takes a bit of getting used too but once you get over it the place is amazing. By the time we were ready to leave we were really enjoying our time. If money was no object then Caesars Palace, The Bellagio or Venetian would be my choice. Nothing wrong with the Luxor for the price we paid but I doubt we'll be back having now seen the sights.
reviews.title: Vegas is hurting and it is not doing much to help itself

likes.disliked: — The customer service and timeshare people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had anticipated paying a premium in Las Vegas at New Year so was happy to upgrade to a Spa Room at extra cost.
reviews.title: Great room, terrible noise

reviews.text: Check-in was swift but friendly service lacked (I have to say it lacked all over Vegas, the opposite to my last trip here) and information available to check-in agent meant we had to convince her that we had already paid for our room, very frustrating.
reviews.title: Would Go Back!!!

likes.liked: — close proximity for driving to outlet malls, and activities outside of Vegas
likes.disliked: — rooms are a little old, and could use an upgrade

reviews.text: I arrived and the check-in experience was great. They worked to find me the room type I'd reserved in a quick and efficient manner.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs Beware!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to bed and awoke the next morning to find bites on my lower abdomen, back and ankle. I reported this to the front desk. The person at the desk advised that they would send a security person to my room to investigate. Would I be there? YES. The security person arrived took digital photographs of the bites and advised that they had a "process" under which all of my belongings would be cleaned and or laundered including my suitcase and of course I'd be moved to another room.
reviews.title: not lovin the Luxor

reviews.text: I checked back a couple hours later to find that they had not cleaned any of the clothing but had assigned me to a new room in a different wing of the hotel. Admittedly, a much nicer room.
reviews.title: Great, comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I attempted to try and speak with the hotel manager at checkout the next day and he was unavailable. I tried repestedly to call him and wrote a letter stating only the facts. I finally received a reply from Loss Management stating they didn't believe my claim and considered it settled. I was asking for a refund of 1 nights room & tax (about $100). Next day I receive an e-mail offering m a free nights stay on my next visit. Next visit to a bed bug hotel? No Thanks.
reviews.title: Enjoyed My Stay

likes.liked: — A lot to see and do

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed at the LUXOR on the 26 - 30.
reviews.title: Quite shabby
Lot to be desired
reviews.text: With 4 guests ahead of me, it still took an hour to get checked in.

reviews.title: Good value for your dollar.
reviews.text: While my room was quite nice and had an incredible view, the lack of hot water in the morning was more than inconvenient. I called down to the front desk and they said "It takes awhile for the hot water to make it all the way up. Just keep it running. After 25 minutes, the water was lukewarm enough to take a shower.

reviews.title: Vast & confusing, but alright
reviews.text: Went to Vegas for the first time this past November and stayed at the Luxor. I was impressed with the structure from the outside but was a little disappointed with the interior. It was a letdown. However, the rooms were clean, quiet and nicely furnished. We didn't shell out the cashola for a suite, but, we didn't spend a whole lot of time in our room anyway. It was a little far from the strip attractions, but, it was near the airport and easy to find. This price was right and the service was ok too. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a clean nice hotel at an economical price. The downside to the facility was the extreme distances to anything inside. We had to walk a long long way to get to our room, which probably is why we didn't spend too much time there. The service was fine, we didn't have any complaints. The only glitch that we ran into was the hotels age on fixtures. Our shower tub handle was corrding off and the doors were a little used on the inside. A small feature, but, for a place that sells glitz and glamour, these details stick out like a soar thumb.

reviews.title: loved it
reviews.text: All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. I would however, recommend that you request a tower room. More room and less money.

reviews.title: No complaints
reviews.text: Well, I guess it is my fault for staying in a hotel this size - large even by Vegas standards. First we could not find our way into the hotel, then we could not find the front desk, then we could not find the room. Later on, we could not find our way out of the hotel, and could not find the restaurant we wanted to eat at (later learned it was closed for renovation, although there was a menu in our room). The room was attractive and immaculate, view was not so great from the pyramid section of the hotel. Most of the staff I dealt with (reservations, front desk) were QUITE rude. I would not stay there again, but I might still recommend it to someone who was looking for that kind of overwhelming Vegas experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in the Luxor. Had a corner suite in the Pyramid which had a spa bath overlooking the Strip - great fun!! Suite was well looked after, clean and neat. Quiet rooms. Beds comfortable.
reviews.title: Spa it up - you know you want to!

reviews.text: Only ate in-house once - at the breakfast buffet which was good value. Good slots/tables. Some minor reconstruction going on, but generally not intrusive.
reviews.title: Absolutely fine, and pretty much as expected

reviews.text: We ate at the Bellagio evening buffet - get there early to lessen the wait, but it is worth it. Also try Shibuya at the MGM for sushi - great service and food.
reviews.title: Great Weekend at Luxor - Love the Pyramid!

likes.disliked: — Room was a little on the dark side even when all the lights were on.

reviews.text: The only downside is the long check-in wait (where are all the staff?) and the long distances you have to drag your suitcase. Generally though, I would stay there again....although the Bellagio looked nice.....
reviews.title: Good hotel, decent location but far for grandparents...

likes.disliked: — had to pay for internet ($13 per day) and gym usage ($10 per day)

reviews.text: I stayed in the Luxor for two nights, and found it to be absolutely fine, and pretty much exactly as I expected.
reviews.title: Bad Service and Rundown Room

likes.liked: — Location at south end of Strip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My Wife and I stayed at Luxor last Feb.25th-Mar.1. We had such a great time their that we are returning in exactly 60 days. (Not that we're counting). Checkin was run smoothly, long lines but moved quckly. When we opened door to our tower room there was a sticky substance on floor just. It seemed like the Maid must of been drinking a soda and it spilled off her cart as she was exiting our room. I called maid service and they showed up within 5 minutes,after a slight language barrier (which my wife handled) She speaks Spanish, it was cleaned. The room was spacious and we had view of Ex Cal and Trop, A/C worked well. I am not a fan of Buffet, hundreds of people standing over food you are about to eat isn't exactly appetizing to me. We ate breakfast everyday at the Pyramid Cafe (open 24hrs). Food was very good as was service. I enjoy wagering on Horse Racing from time to time. Went to Luxor's Sports Book to dabble in my elicit activity. ITS IMPOSSIBLE to concentrate on The Racing Form with the very loud slot machines 5 feet away from the seating area of the Book. Mandalay and even Ex-Cal was much more conducive for a day of SimulBlasting! Other than that, we LOVE The Luxor and are going back in 2 months.
reviews.title: Luxor ok to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently returned from our honeymoon which was a multi-centre trip to the USA. During this we spent 3 nights at the Luxor.
reviews.title: Don't even bother, big disappointment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We expected the hotel to be amazing but were very disappointed. There was a long queue at check-in and when were finally seen, found the reception staff to be very unfriendly and not particularly welcoming.
reviews.title: Luxor Mixed Feelings
Las Vegas - Exceptional Luxor Stay
reviews.text: After eventually checking in, whilst trying to navigate our way through a very busy lobby and casino with our suitcases to find inclinator 3 (poorly signposted) we were pounced on by sales people promising us discounted or free show tickets. The catch being you had to go to a time share presentation. This was promised to be no more than 2 hours but turned into 4 hours hardsell. We were angry that we were pounced on the virtually the minute we got there when we tired and disorientated. Every time we tried to get in or out of the hotel we were pounced on again which was very frustrating.

Apart from the lobby area which was quite impressive, the rest of the hotel was very shabby and looked as if it needed an overhaul. The carpets were dirty and worn, the walls were marked and it was generally grubby. The room itself which was in the pyramid was quite basic considering the described class of the hotel and it was very dreary and dark, the bed linen was very worn and the bed very uncomfortable. The bathroom was not very clean either and the whole room looked as if it needed a good clean.
reviews.title: Luxor Stinks!

reviews.text: The Luxor is an awesome hotel. The first steps inside are just amazing and something you would never experience anywhere else. We stayed here from 28/09 - 01/10. The check-in line was quite long but is understandable due to the size of the hotel. However it did not take long to get through. Our room was on the 25th floor and had an amazing view of Mandalay Bay and areas surrounding. As we walked out the door we could see over the walkway balcony thing straight down to the top floor. Quite spectacular. The pool area is just gorgeous. Great place to be in the afternoon. The shopping inside the hotel was great and the hotel has easy access to Mandalay Bay and Excalibur through walkways and a monorail type thing. The room was clean and very nicely themed. Even the shower cap came in a pyramid shaped box. The bathroom was big, however it did not have a bath but who really cares. We had some laundry done while we were staying there as our previous hotels that we had stayed in did not have a laundry service or were extremely expensive. But we found the Luxor to be cheap and our laundry was in our wardrobe and ironed for us when we came back at night. The Luxor is located down one end of the strip but there are buses, monorails and taxis to transport you to the other end. During our stay we visited the Grand Canyon and the bus picked us up and dropped us off from the Excalibur. Very handy. Overall we loved this hotel. The theme and the way it has been decorated is just amazing. Simply an unbelievable place.
reviews.title: loved the luxor!
Good except for the thin walls
reviews.text: This was the 11th strip hotel we have stayed at and the only one that we had a problem with hearing EVERYTHING from the adjacent room. (We were in a tower room). It was a major problem when we were trying to sleep. After 2 nights, we called the front desk and were moved to a different room. Despite the supervisor telling me that the hotel was only half full, we were moved to a room with an inferior view. Otherwise, the hotel was fine. Bathrooms are very nice. Restaurants are good. We saw Criss Angel twice in the hotel. As for gambling, not enough poker slot machines.
Stayed 28 Dec 06 - 1 Jan 07. It's an amazing place the Luxor, as are most of the large hotel-casinos on the strip.
reviews.title: New Years @ the Luxor

likes.liked: — It's huge with something for everyone

reviews.title: Our trip to Las Vegas
reviews.text: Room: Mostly clean and tidy, and serviced well each day. No free internet, but it is Vegas so you can expect to get charged for everything. The bed was very comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: Bar staff and check in staff were all friendly, polite and helpful, which was good considering how busy it was over New Year.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our Stay

likes.disliked: — A bit far from main action

reviews.title: Well... it's a pyramid
reviews.text: I've searched for a fun (and different) hotel to stay in Las Vegas (afterall.. it's Las Vegas :-P) and booked the Luxor (the pyramid not the tower).
But besides fun of staying in the pyramid, the hotel had old sheets and towels, does not have a safe in the room and internet wasn't free.
reviews.title: luxor the place to party

reviews.text: Also, there weren't many good options to eat there (just some fast foods or the steakhouses, not an average restaurant). There was a cafe which served some burgers, but it looked a little pricey for what they offer.
reviews.title: Pleasant stay

reviews.text: It wasn't a bad hotel, but for the price I think you can find a better hotel.
reviews.title: Better then most on the strip

likes.liked: — Views, Lovely Rooms, Option of Food
likes.disliked: — To Far up South End of the Strip

reviews.text: if you are going to vegas then why not stay at the luxor dont be put off by bad reports i stayed there with my girlfriend for a week at the end of november and it was great. if you go to vegas why are you going to complain about the hotel rooms sure the luxor rooms are a bit dated but they ars very clean i stayed in the tower and it was fine. when you are in vegas in my opinion a room is only a place to put your head down at the end of the night there is so much to see and do you shouldnt be in your room. inside the luxor itself is very smart they have not long opened a superclub called lax its very trendy with the odd celeb turning up its a great night but can be quite pricey for a drink $60 for 4 drinks but hey your in vegas so big deal they have also opened a couple of trendy bars called aurora and flight the bar prices are just about the same as any nice bar in britain so ok there then .also as i was leaving that night nicky hilton and that guy who was married to jessica simpson nick whatever were opening another restaurant/bar inside luxor so for value for money i think its a great bet
reviews.title: So So

likes.disliked: — Long walks through Casino to reach anywhere to anywhere. Attractions Not working.

reviews.title: Not much going on outside the lobby
reviews.text: The Luxor hotel is a beautiful hotel with a huge wow factor... that is, until you get into your room. The rooms are pretty basic and there's nothing special to them. The slanted wall is interesting for about 5 minutes. The beds are clean, but very stiff and the blankets are starchy and itchy. The bathroom is nice and big, but the shower had something funky going on and maintenance took their sweet time getting up there to fix it. When they finally did, they left this disgusting black stuff behind and we had to call housekeeping (who was very nice).

reviews.title: The Luxor's OK...
reviews.text: Room service was slow and the food was okay -- nothing special. My husband was very disappointed that the room was so difficult to get to.

reviews.title: Pyramid Power
reviews.text: There are only 2 elevators that went to our floor, and they were at the far ends of the hotel. Access to the room took a lot of walking. My only other complaint is that the Luxor is way down at the end of the strip, so you have to walk forever to get anywhere. The best part of the hotel though is the price. It's pretty decent if you book ahead.

reviews.title: Will Always Love the Luxor!
reviews.text: Had read many reviews on the Luxor before visitng in Jan '04. Most had bits of truth to them. We requested a tower room and were quite pleased. Decor was fine, bathroom was nice. My one MAJOR complaint about the actual room was how thin the walls were. We could VERY clearly hear conversations in the next room (thanks goodness it was just conversations!) and when the phone rang next door it was clear enough to think it was our own! I found the hotel a bit tough to find your way around - terrible signage, but no big deal. La Salsa restaurant had great mexican food. The Japanese restaurant was super expensive (at least in comparison to the sushi places here) and mediocre quality. The rate we paid was decent, but if I were to return to Vegas, I would throw in the extra money to stay further up the Strip (maybe at the Aladdin, which was similar in price). We ended up spending most of our time in the Belaggio area and it was a bit of a hike back and forth (especially when dressed up to go out at night) so we ended blowing a ton of money on cabs. If the Luxor was significantly cheaper than someplace like the Aladdin, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, but we prefered something a bit newer and further up the Strip. All in all, not too bad

reviews.title: Not a four star hotel and wouldn't stay there again
reviews.text: The best way to describe the Luxor is that this is not a four star hotel. There are no safes in the rooms, no minibars. We'd booked a spa suite and were put on the top floor of the pyramid. The furniture is scruffy and the decor was old and tired. Nt just in the room but in the lifts and corridors. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that and we only had a few drinks there. The casino seemed fairly average Vegas standard.
Also increasingly annoying were the tinmeshare staff, on one occasion we were approached 4 times just walking from one side of reception to the other.
reviews.title: Outstanding in every way!
The not so Lux Luxor
reviews.text: The Luxor looks good fronm the outside, the pyramid looks impressive, especially at night, but the interior is a let down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with a friend at the Luxor on Monday, December 29, 2008 until Friday, January 2, 2009. It was simply superb from the moment you enter the hotel until you leave. Check in was a breeze! I recommend staying in the Pyramid rooms. They are great! The More buffet is wonderful! All the bars are great! We stayed and partied at the Aurora bar on New Years Eve. We had a blast! The hotel is connected to the Excaliber which makes getting to the strip easy. Even check out is great. The only comment I have is the hotel charges a $2.00 daily service phone charge. We didn't use the phone were still charged. That's about the only complaint. I will definitely return to the Luxor!
reviews.title: Not Worth It..

reviews.text: I booked this on priceline for new years eve, and a few days after. I was pretty unimpressed! The staff was rude and not very helpful. The room was NOT a 4 star, as they claim. The tub and shower were pretty dirty. The bed was sooo uncomfortible.
reviews.title: The Pyramid was cool at least!!!

reviews.text: Me and my buddies stayed here for my bachelor party and got 2 rooms. We were supposed to be in the Pyramid but actually got 2 adjoining rooms in the tower and they were awesome. I can't believe all of the negative reviews on the property. We were very satisfied with everything here. The rooms were very clean and the bathrooms were huge and very nice. No compliants at all. I have stayed at the Monte Carlo and the Golden Nugget in the past and the Luxor is by far my favorite. The pool is awesome and the clientel at this place was young and very attractive. It's like and MTV atmosphere 24 hours a day. The club here (LAX) was very cool and we went there both nights. Chris Angel was there the 2nd night. That was pretty cool. Anyway, ignore the negative reviews, this hotel is a great value.
reviews.title: The best in Vegas

reviews.text: We just got back last night after a five day stay in the West Tower. (March 31st - April 5th) We didn't get the non- smoking room with one King sized bed we wanted. Instead, we were told the "only" room they had was a smoking two doubled bed room and that we could move the next day if we wanted a non- smoking room. This was a major hassle to switch due to our schedule and the fact that we let the Luxor know two weeks in advance that we were arriving on a 1:00AM flight and checking in late.We checked into our room at 2:30 am, there was a very long line and only 3 people working. It took over 25 minutes to check in!The room was large but very dark =despite having all the light on. The mattress was lumpy and soft causing us to both wake up with back aches. There are NO coffee makers in the rooms and from the West Tower, its a 10 minute walk to a very expensive Starbucks, even a longer walk to the Food court for a MAc Donalds coffee which was a good cup of reasonable priced Joe.. IF your Mum is not bothered by glaring neon signs and the constant advertising of half naked women on screens all over the Luxor, showing the lounges called "Cathouse" and "Fantasy Topless Revue", then this might be the place for them.My husband and I took a walk over to Mandalay Bay, which is right next door. It is beautiful, understated elegance, quiet and top quality. We did a price comparison between the Luxor and Mandalay and for the $200.00 more for the five days we were there, the Mandalay Bay was very much worth it, they really go out of the way to make your stay pleasant. You get what you pay for!
reviews.title: Don't stay at The Luxor

likes.liked: — The bath tub, it was large, deep and had back support!
likes.disliked: — Poor lighting in rooms, having to walk thru the casino to get anywhere, not getting the non smoking room we requested

reviews.text: Overall, our opinion is The Luxor is tacky, a maze to get around in and not restful. There are no quiet places to sit and relax, unless you like smokey bars and casino's. Also, the rooms, like other people have said, are dark and dingy, even thought we were in the West tower and it was NEW. But, they are large and have a lot of storage space. Also, tell your parents to ignore the people handing out cards.... they are cards for prostitutes... what these card handlers do is "slap" the cards to get your attention, then literally try to put them in your hands. Ignore them. The streets are littered with tons of cards portraying nude or topless women and their phone numbers.
reviews.title: Good value, rooms shabby service can be awful

likes.disliked: — Expensive internet, poor service from hotel (although bell hops were great)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another tip someone told us about and we used, there are several areas called "HALF TICKETS" We got them next to the giant Coke bottle at MGM.. We got great seats (second row center) to see "The Fab Four Mania", a group that sounded and looked like the Beatles. It was superb! We got these tickets the same day of the show and they had lots of shows to offer. Highly recommended! Best of all, there was no catch and no boring time shares to sit thru.!
reviews.title: Relatively nice, but probably past its' prime

likes.liked: — The cleanliness of the hotel, dinner buffet desserts, toiletries and free parking
likes.disliked: — Tired decor, sales pitches, the IMAX ride

reviews.text: To wrap this review up, I also thought that people who were critical of the Luxor were the types that could not be satisfied anywhere they stayed, but, in retrospect, I should of listened to their advice and stayed elsewhere.
reviews.title: Exactly as expected, no problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in the pyramid part of the hotel it was excellent and comfy a little won in places but stiil will be back
reviews.title: we loved it and will be back in 2012

reviews.text: I stayed in this most fabulous Hotel and I have to say it was like living in a Dream. I had a detox Herbal wrap and a massage it was Terrific and also most Therapeutic, I Highly reccomend this Hotel and All that They offer.
reviews.title: Detox

It meant we then joined check in even further back down the long line. At first we were disheartened by the long line but it did move quite quickly.
reviews.title: Luxor - Pyramid spa suite

reviews.text: The west tower room was large and spacious for four on the 17th floor and had a view of the pool.
reviews.title: Luxor Does Not Disappoint
Interesting hotel
