reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed our stay but thought the pool closed too early and were sold tickets for a ride that wasn't running when we walked over to it two minutes later. Obviously we got our money back but the children were disappointed.
reviews.title: Luxor left me a bit dissapointed/frustrated

reviews.text: Stayed at the Luxor this past weekend. This was my 8th trip in the last 4 years to Vegas; and I wanted to try out a different hotel. So I tried the Luxor. I have to say that this will probably be the last time that I visit. Not saying it was bad. But it definitely wasn't great.
reviews.title: If you're looking for a great Vegas hotel....this ain't the place
dark, boring dealers
reviews.text: -Check-in took over half an hour. There were simply too many people checking in and not enough open windows to assist. No big deal. This is Vegas. And it was the first week of MArch Madness.
-Getting to the room was a big hassle. It was a long walk to the East Tower--the new tower. Elevators were fast though.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! :-)

reviews.text: -Got to room--it was top notch for a standard room until we went to sleep. Found out too much marble and thin walls don't contribute to a great night's sleep. On one side, a couple got very romantic (not bad I guess) but on the other side, it sounded like a frat party. Again, this is Vegas.
reviews.title: The Luxor - What a great hotel!
Worst hotel experience ever
reviews.text: People do party here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When this hotel opened in 90s, I'm sure it was a top of the line, amazing resort. But it feels as if they have done nothing since to compete with the nicer hotels on the strip. Sure it is still stunning when you first walkin, but once you get over the way it looks it's really lacking in many areas.
reviews.title: Not that impressive...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on what it looked like online, we decided to pay a little extra and get a jacuzzi suite. It was really disspointing. It wasnt nearly as nice as the pictures showed. The jacuzzi itself wasnt bad, but more like a large bath. The furniture was worn and outdated, and the room felt cramped even though it was a suite. In reality its just a hotel room with a very small extra sitting area. Which never even gets used. So I wouldnt even call it a suite. And the walk from the elevator took about 5 mins. They need to make some of the rooms more accessible to the inclinators. The casino itself was also not that great. Unfriendly dealers, and a real lack of any excitement is the best way to describe it. Room service was good, but the buffet was terrible in my opinion. All in all I wont say this is a terrible hotel, but it really falls short to most other places in Vegas I have stayed at. It almost feels like they kinda stopped trying or something.
reviews.title: Fantastic Luxor Las Vegas

reviews.text: I visited Luxor Resort in Las Vegas with my Wife for 6 nights in beginning June 2006. This was our 5th time in Vegas. We almost travel to Vegas every year. This was our first time at Luxor. We Stayed i na pyramid room on 12th floor with a nice view of Mandalay Bay towers. We enjoyed elevators or inclinators as they are called up to our floor. We found the Buffet at Luxor really enjoyable and good. We also recommend Burger Bar at the walkway to Mandalay Bay. Really nice burgers and fun bar!
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also loved Luxors amazing lobby and looking up inside the pyramid.
reviews.title: Sub-Par Experience With Luxor

reviews.text: We will stay in a tower room this year. As I heard they are newer rooms.
reviews.title: Luxor has lost it brightness

likes.disliked: — Lack of wifi and no fitted sheets on bed.

reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Luxor in december 2007, we had read some of the reviews and were a little concerned, but we have to say the reception staff couldnt be more helpfull and were willing to help in any way they could. (sometimes wish english hotels would take a hint)
reviews.title: great time, will go back.

reviews.text: Our room was big and although we wanted a non smoking room and there was none available but we was upgraded for the trouble. The rooms were clean and tidy and very spacious, we had a wonderful view from the 20th floor, another good thing is that you cannot get to your floor if you dont have a valid room key to acctivate the lift, that made it very reassuring for us as we were two ladies on our own.
reviews.title: Very nice but not the BEST location.

reviews.text: The whole experience was fantastic and we are already planning our next trip to the Luxor with our partners.
reviews.title: confusion

likes.liked: — location,,,for me,,,i like to base off of this area of the strip....seems easier for me
likes.disliked: — casino dealers,,,,rude,,I MEAN [--]...didnt let it happen too long and packed up my wallet and gambled elsewhere,,,thankyou but no thankyou....

reviews.text: We didnt play the casino tables but had a few goes on the machines we were offered a players card to which we thought we wouldnt need but we got some very nice freebies for our trouble, a free t-shirt, massages, breakfasts and the list goes on, but what we should have done was book the room direct as then we would have got it at a very special rate, we plan to do this next time.
reviews.title: dont go in December

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A quick tip, wear senible walking shoes as the walking can go on for hours!!! but very good cant wait to go back.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: I have stayed at the Luxor several times over the years and felt it was getting old and tired. My work group decided to meet in Las Vegas and the Luxor was chosen because of the reasonable prices. I booked a tower room and was pleasantly surprised. Our check in hostess was friendly and explained everything that would be on the bill including the resort fee. She also took the time to review with us the different attractions of the hotel and the coupon book that was given to us at check in. In addition, she offered to look for a room in the east tower on the same floor as one of my friends. She found a room near my friend but let me know it would not have a view. I was fine with that and just happy about the room location. The room was large and clean. The bathroom was huge with a nice jacuzzi type tub and separate walk in shower. The room had a large flat screen TV and the thermostat worked well to keep the temperature nice and cool. I had a slight problem when the TV remote quit working (battery out). I left a note for the housekeeping staff and the remote had been replaced when I came back to the room after my meetings.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: Another tip - we had a small group and needed a place to meet. When I checked in, I asked how much it would cost to upgrade my boss to a suite. For $50 more per night he
reviews.title: Loved Vegas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: was given a huge suite with a separate bedroom, wet bar, etc. We were able to meet comfortably in the living room of the suite. The bathroom was fantastic with double sinks and all the expected amenities. What a bargain, since we only paid $70 per night for our rooms in the first place!
reviews.title: Luxor Terrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definitely return if I'm looking for an nice, economical place to stay on the strip.
reviews.title: Not impressed!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed with a big group of friends here, hotel is lovely and clean, staff friendly (probably because they expect to be tipped all the time, for everything!) Rooms were lovely, the beds are the most comfortable I have ever slept in! I'm not a gambler so not really interested in the casino's. The reception staff don't really know whats going on, even though they will give you an answer to your question (usually wrong), the best people to ask are the cleaners, they seem to know what's going on. Use the free shuttle which is located at the front of the hotel, the other side of the taxi rank, then use the monorail to go even further or the buses, and don't forget to take comfortable walking shoes with you, this place is huge and even if you do use public transport you will walk a very long way. Swimming pool was closed whilst we were there, even though we were told we could use another hotels swimming pool, we never found it.
reviews.title: It is in need of repairs and upgrades.

reviews.text: The Luxor is one of the most famous hotels so seemed appropriate to stay there and we got a great deal! Overall, this is a great hotel. Staff and concierge are very friendly and helpful and although the check in queue can get long, it seems to go down quite quickly.
reviews.title: Good location and reasonably priced

likes.liked: — The pool area and the fact you have everything you need here
likes.disliked: — The poolside cleaners on sun lounger emptying patrol!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just a few notes, it is now their off season and so one of the pools and the pool snack bar is now closed. However, the larger pool is still open as well as the bar and there are plenty of food places inside. Please be careful with your stuff though; there are signs up saying if you leave a sun lounger unattended for an hour it will be assumed to be free. We left ours for 30 mins to grab something for lunch (as the pool snack bar was closed) and came back to find not only the towels removed but also our guide book, sun cream and water bottles thrown in the bin!! Wish they had put so much dedication to cleaning our room as there were a couple of days when we didn't get clean towels etc.
reviews.title: A Nice Place To Say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are quite dark, as lighting is low, I think it is the theme? They are spacious though and have everything you need. Although you are at one end of the strip, you can walk / get a tram to most places and get taxis back if you're tired. Overall we had a great experience here and think we got a lot for our money.
reviews.title: Stayed at the Luxor for our 1st Vegas Trip

reviews.text: Our group choose the Luxor for our Oct 28-31 stay because of its affordability. We stayed on the 22nd floor in the pyramid in a spa suite that featured an in room Jacuzzi, two queen beds, separate sitting room and a huge bathroom. The accommodations were spacious and nearly half of the price of a comparable room elsewhere in Vegas. There are some trade offs that came with the cheap prices. The pyramid is need of a lot of upkeep. While the building and grounds are clean they are not as “polished” as other strip properties. Peeling paint and wall paper could be found in public areas of the hotel as well as some other visual detractors. Some of the signs posting floor numbers in the elevators areas appeared to have been ripped off the walls. Rust and calcium was evident around plumbing fixtures. The guest room furniture was far from new, the tables and the armoire had many dings, scratches and the venire was pealing. The carpeting was worn and was stained in more than a few places. The interior of the inclinators showed their age with many scratches, dents and cracks in the mirrored interior. I think that most people would be turned off by the condition of the facilities. The pool area is nice but can be become very cramped on a warm day. The staff was helpful. House keeping was very efficient. The breakfast buffet was great. Overall the Luxor is a good regular small town hotel but not in the same league as the other MGM/Mirage hotels.
reviews.title: Old, a bit out of date but still an experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 1st trip for Vegas - for my husband's 30th birthday. Booked our travel package (airfare & room at The Luxor) via Travelocity. We picked the Luxor mainly because the price was right, but also because my husband - a vintage t-shirt aficionado - has an old t-shirt from the Luxor. Were always curious about it based on that. (Yes, a weird reason to pick a hotel.)
reviews.title: Good OLD Luxor
Pluses and minuses
reviews.text: Minuses first: (1) Starbucks prices are far higher than normal -- this is too bad -- everyone knows what Starbucks costs normally, so this is hard to ignore -- the extra income isn't worth the hit to Luxor's image; (2) carpets in the Pyramid are very worn -- the whole place needs an upgrade (in contrast, the renovated Tower is fabulous); (3) no wireless internet and $11.99/day for cable hook up -- wireless ought to be available throughout the hotel, and it ought to be free; (4) normal rooms in the Pyramid are just "so-so" -- a decent deal for the price, but nothing fancy -- suites are much nicer and worth the cost of an upgrade.

likes.liked: — Free and efficient valet parking; great rates on room upgrades; courteous and efficient staff
likes.disliked: — Surcharges for Starbucks; lack of wireless access; lack of free internet access; worn carpets in Pyramid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pluses: (1) Free (and efficient) valet parking -- this is one of the nicest features of staying at the Luxor; (2) wonderful spa (jacuzzi) suite on upper floors in Pyramid with terrific views of Las Vegas; (3) very responsive "maintenance" staff; (4) pleasant and helpful check-in staff; (5) great rates on upgrades for rooms; (6) fabulous IMAX movies (Moon and Nile were great); (7) Pepsi available everywhere (but Coke lovers have to go elsewhere); (8) simple and fast Express Check-Out.
reviews.title: Marginal at best

likes.liked: — Seedy, unkept room and bad customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend had booked this hotel for our weekend trip to Vegas. Upon arriving, we had to wait a little while for a 4:00 pm check-in, which was to be expected considering the afternoon rush. However, upon checking in we were informed that our room still had not been cleaned and we could expect to wait another hour or so before they could get to it. Instead of offering to hold our luggage, or anything above and beyond, we were forced to wander around the hotel lobby.
reviews.title: A Great Hotel for the Money

likes.disliked: — too much smoke, time share salespeople

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we made it to our floor, the carpet in the hallway was torn up in places and the paint was chipping off of the walls in places. When we got to the room, it reeked of industrial strength cleaner, and since the windows don't open in the pyramid, we had to turn on the bathroom fan and prop the door open. However, we were only able to stay in the room for 15 minutes before we started getting headaches and had to leave.
reviews.title: Middle-class, nice, and quiet

likes.disliked: — Don't eat the Pharaoh's Feast buffet or The Steakhouse. Eat at the Bellagio buffet.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was small and the wallpaper was peeling away from the wall near the shower.
reviews.title: Great!!

likes.disliked: — All the construction they were doing

reviews.text: Rooms were clean, and cleaned eveyday,had a great view of the strip. Prices were reasonable.
reviews.title: would stay here again

reviews.text: Luxor Hotel in Las Vegas has seen better days. I have stayed there many times over the years since it opened, but my last stay was just that - my last stay.
reviews.title: Decent value for the price, but no super bargain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I asked for a strip view, and was accomodated - or, so I was led to believe. I did arrive early, and when I confirmed my room request (view, etc), I was told to come back after 3:00 (official check-in time), but that they would block off a room for me that fit my request. I came back a little after 3:00 and received my requested room. No one informed me that their strip view is only a tiny portion of Las Vegas Blvd., and primarily a view of the airport. I was only told this after I had checked in and arrived at my room. Although, the room I received was not their version of a "strip view" - it was a good view from the 27th floor of the mountains, and lots of twinkly lights of the city, so still a nice view and I was satisfied.
reviews.title: Great value mid-week

reviews.text: Then there's the extra fees - they advertised a great rate of $63.00 per night - but then added a hotel fee and a "resort fee" on top of that. When I asked about the resort fee, they said it was for the Internet access, along with a newspaper, and access to their workout room. The Internet cable came out from behind the TV, and you had to move the table from across the room to next to the TV stand and closet to have the cable reach your computer. Awkward.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The room was clean, but the shower (no bathtub) puddled while in use so that your feet were in standing water during your shower. They do supply a blow dryer, fresh clean towels, and a modicum of cosmetic accessories (shampoo/conditioner combo, body wash, and lotion). No coffee pot or refrigerator in the room. There was an iron and ironing board in the armoire.
reviews.title: Good place to stay.
The Best
reviews.text: Everything was great. We did not experience any long waits either checking in or checking out. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Dealers were excellent with amateurs and skilled players. Couldn't have been better.

reviews.title: Happy Brits
reviews.text: Stayed at The Luxor 8th to 18th Feb and after reading some of the pre-views we were rather apprehensive. We are two English couples and had been booked into adjoining rooms in the West Tower. They were very well decorated, a good size, very clean and comfortable with a view from the large window of the morning sun rising over the mountains.

reviews.title: Great short stay
reviews.text: Previously we had e-mailed and had immediate replies saying no tea making facilities but the location of eateries providing 24 hour service. We took our own jugkettle as Brits do and fresh milk was available in the kiosk type shops at the bottom of the West Tower near group check-in and near to the lobby. We were also advised that safe deposit boxes were available free of charge at the front desk. We never had a problem accessing them at any time.
Our check in was instant but it was late evening and we did see long queques earlier in the day during our stay.
reviews.title: HATED THE BEDS
OK for the price
reviews.text: The help we had from the Staff was second to none, everyone helped us and served us with a smile.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 4 nights @ Luxor in August. First, I must say that it was first visit in Vegas, and I always wanted to stay @ Luxor. I booked package with flight via hotels.com. Well, I usually check carefully reviews @ Tripadvisor before booking and, to be honest, I was little worrying before arrival. After reading reviews that pyramid rooms are in worst condition I decided to pay $12 extra per night for tower room during booking (front desk was trying to charge me again during check-in for same thing, but printed out reservation helped them to straight it out). We wait in line for approx. 30 min. to check in, but there were more than 100 people before me, so they work relatively fast. I did not checked rooms inside pyramid, but mine was a good choice. Very clean, furniture was relatively new. Bed was comfortable. $11 per 24 hrs using internet is bit expensive; however I needed it to upload pictures. No in-room safe box was disappointment, but thanks God, we did not have problems with laptop or digital camera; even we were leaving for long time. Swimming pools are great, I would say biggest, advantage, however sometimes place is crowded and it was difficult to find spot with 2 sun beds close to each other.
reviews.title: Almost what I was expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don’t play in casino there – looks like Luxor is using it as an income generator, in addition to room charges. We spent few hundreds on the slots; we did not win a penny. I’ve heard that some other casinos (not included on your gamer card from Luxor) are much better. During my 5-day stay I did not see anybody who won something worth to notice (let’s say $100).
reviews.title: Tired, old and very dark

reviews.text: I was tired of looking for restaurant, buffet, pool etc. while walking thru casino. Signs are poor. Looks like it’s done by purpose: you lost inside = you stay and play. Food was very average, nothing to be worth to write here. There is long walk to other places worth to see like Vennetian, Mirage or Bellaggio.
reviews.title: Big pyramid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would come back if I would find better deal (paid $1300 with flight for 2 people from NYC).
reviews.title: Loved the Luxor

likes.disliked: — The restaurants, the pool lawn chairs

reviews.title: Great wedding package, nice place
reviews.text: We stayed at the Luxor and i really wished i had paid a bit more and stayed at the Bellagio. The hotel is definately dated, it was dark and dingy and there was also a funny smell. It is good for those on a budget but as Las Vegas is such a treat, I would advise that you pay a bit more and stay in another hotel.

Check in was fine and we were upgraded to a Tower room. The room was fine but had no room safe. The room wasnt cleaned every day but we were jet lagged and i guess the room wasnt always available to clean.The facilities at the Luxor are very average and the food court was closed due to refurbishment. The pool complex was nice but there is little or no shade. Location wise it is right up the other end of the strip and in hindsight I would have prefered a hotel mid strip. Price wise if you want a cheap hotel that needs a bit of a refurbishment then this fits the bill.
reviews.title: Very average Las Vegas hotel

reviews.text: Word of warning if you are a non smoker all the casino areas in vegas allow smoking it isnt pleasant
reviews.title: 2 room suite is the way to go!

reviews.text: We needed to go to Vegas for business at the Mandalay and they were sold out-so we opted for the Luxor. Now I have heard the stories about not staying in the pyramid-it's too hot, etc. But this room was in a tower. The room had a bedroom and a separate living room/eating area. A sink, mini fridge and COFFEEPOT. A nice addition to a Vegas room. Make sure you confirm these items when you book. Nothing worse than walking 15 miles through a casino for that first cup of coffee in the morning. Anyway-the service was great, room was awesome. Since you were off the main room-you NEVER heard any noise from the hallways as you slept. It was really not to bad price wise either. We also liked the T&T restaurant-super good food.
reviews.title: Different, but just "OK"

reviews.text: I had always wanted to stay at Luxor in the pyramid. It was very cool to see down to the casino floor from the room, but overall, the rooms, hallways, etc were getting a little worn and run down. The whole place reeked of cigarette smoke, so the ventilation isn't great. it was definitely cool (the elevators are on an angle!) but I likely wouldn't stay again.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, they charge a "resort fee" of about $20 a day on top of your room rate, which they don't tell you about, at all, when you book, whether on their website or even a travel one like Travelocity. It should be stated up front so people are prepared.
reviews.title: Its perfect if you just want somewhere to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's sad, really, to play ball with an old, arthritic dog when there are dozens of fresh puppies in the park. Likewise, it's just a bid sad that the Luxor is already run down in less than 20 years of operation, and so many newer, shinier lodging options exist in Vegas.
reviews.title: Luxor is Long in the Tooth

reviews.text: Luxor "has it all" in the Las Vegas sense: shows, clubs, restaurants, (and of course the casino floor,) but returning to one's room has a feeling of a depressing surrender. The once clever pyramid motif now mainly results in a nauseating elevator ride up a not-exactly-vertical and not-horizontal plane.
reviews.title: Love the Luxor

reviews.text: Rooms have areas of peeling wall paper, crumbly spots in the drywall, and circa-1993 tube televisions without much tech. Wifi is not offered; you'll need a cord and you'll shell out for the privilege to go on line, on top of a $15 per day "resort fee." Towels are thin and smell like they were washed with the kitchen linens. When we tried to press our clothes for the wedding in The Chapel at the Luxor, we found that the iron barely heated and the ironing board was a K-Mart cheapo. Around the hotel, I noticed dozens (hundreds? thousands?) of greasy hand and palm prints on the glass doors accessing the pool and exiting the hotel. Is it that hard to have someone spray a little Windex to spiff things up?
reviews.title: Why not stay in a pyramid?

reviews.text: There's a queasy "eww" feeling to the Luxor that most Vegas hotels don't share.
reviews.title: Always a pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the plus side, the bed was comfy, our room was quiet at night, and had a jacuzzi tub which was kinda fun. The room did have quite a bit of space, which it needed space because the slanted "pyramid" wall encroached on our headroom.
reviews.title: It is just Ok but I wouldn't return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Luxor for Christmas. We arrived at the hotel on Christmas day and it took approx 10 minutes to check-in. Desk staff were very friendly. We had a pyramid room which was surprisingly quite large. It was clean and there were plenty of towels and toiletries. As it was a pyramid room we did get a small amount of noise but nothing to complain about. The food was ok but we liked to eat at different hotels each day. The housekeeping was done daily and without any problems. I can only comment that this hotel was good value. We have stayed at the Bellagio before and of course the service was excellent all round but you do get what you pay for and we found the Luxor fine.
reviews.title: Hotel good value

likes.disliked: — Time share desks (but most of the hotels seem to do this)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for one night only! Thank goodness!
reviews.title: What a dump!

likes.liked: — I only had to stay one night
likes.disliked: — I had to stay one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed in a pyramid room and all the bad reviews are accurate.
reviews.title: Prepare to pay for the air you breathe (and don't expect much)

reviews.text: Old mattresses, dirty walls, old fixtures, nasty carpets, and rotten old towels. Our non smoking room smelled like smoke and so did the towels. Amenities are garbage. Long check in and timeshare nags everywhere. Just don't stay here. Even the Westin is far far better than this place. Flamingo is way better. Heck I bet that Hooters is better but I have not stayed there. If you have to spend a few more bucks to stay at NYNY, MGM, Mirage, etc. Do it. The Rio is good too. Luxor is a shi$hole. If the Excalibur or Tropicana is cheaper you may as well stay there and save yourself some money for a run down dump.
reviews.title: Christmas Holiday at the Luxor

reviews.text: I want my money back.
reviews.title: Great Time at the Luxor, again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for a kid free long weekend. We booked a suite and hotel was fine overall and what you'd expect from a four star place. It's location at the end of the strip means there is some walking to be done to get around to other parts of town. The prices seem to reflect the location.
reviews.title: Not the Bellagio, Venetian or Paris but good and priced right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the hotel after a long flight to be told that they lost our reservation. They gave us another room on the fourth floor (for which the elevator was out of service) and said that we needed to call our travel agent to resubmit the reservation that we had already paid for or else we would be charged a second time. I took care of that and when I called the front desk about getting the credits for our complimentary breakfast or lunch buffet meal, they told us to make our way to the lobby and they would give them to us. Once in the lobby, the front desk staff said that this wasn't written on our reservation and therefore wouldn' be getting them. We had to use the stairs since the elevator was not servicing our floor, and it seemed like the stairwell was being used as a garbage depository by the contractors. Seeing a half decomposed banana wasn't that bad, but smelling it made things worse. Also, for an area that had no smoking signs in it, there were a lot of cigarette butts. Some of the patrons in an adjacent room ordered room service and left their tray in the hallway when they were done. It took housekeeping a day and a half to pick it up. The only good thing about this stay was that I can now say I spent a few nights in a pyramid. I would not recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Will not be staying here again

reviews.text: Great Hotel in a good location. Rates are reasonable the bars are fun and the gambling will take all of your money! But for a hotel this is a great place at a great price!
reviews.title: Great Value at The Luxor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Vegas for our 30th birthdays in April this year for a week. We stayed at Luxor hotel as it looked quirky and was very reasonably priced. Since it was our first holiday after getting married too the hotel staff up graded our room for free! Our room was very spacious and had a hint of luxury in the marble bathroom. There was no minibar though, which would have been a nice extra touch. Sound-proofed windows and rooms meant we had peace and quiet to get sleep when we wanted. Super king size bed was very comfortable and am pleased to say the site for conceiving our first baby!!! So Vegas was very lucky for us!
reviews.title: Celebrating our 30th birthdays in style!

reviews.text: The hotel itself offered a buffet breakfast: all you can eat for $14.99 which was a great start to the day. We also did the champagne brunches on the saturday and sunday too (luckily my birthday fell on the saturday!).
reviews.title: Perfectly ok and cheap

reviews.text: I went for a wedding. It was my first time in Las Vegas and I fell in love with the way the Luxor looks.Outside and in, it is very nice. However, the casino area is dark, dank and smoky and you have to walk through it to get anywhere. My 2nd and 3rd nights were in a room in the tower. although the windows aren't as cool, I didn't have to go up in that shaky elevator. Everyone complains about it. Avoid it. There was some good shopping, but I was thankful to be a few minutes walk from Mandalay Bay. That was the good thing about the Luxor. Service is terrible there from the front desk to room service. They wanted to charge me 5.00 for a plastic fork! I cancelled the order and someone still came. i spilled pesto on my bedspread and called housekeeping. The woman who answered said, "Oh just the bedspread?" and didn't come at all. I won't stay there again. But I got to take some great pictures.
reviews.title: Nice rooms..poor service

likes.liked: — I could walk to Mandalay Bay quickly and easily
likes.disliked: — The staff.. poor quality of service

reviews.title: Great time at the Luxor
reviews.text: This was the 3rd time I've visited Vegas - and glad we picked the Luxor. We stayed in a room on the 24th floor of the pyramid. The room was big with a huge bed. We didn't need the air con on all week as the windows were darkened, so hardly any heat from the sun came in the room. The casino at the hotel was impressive, with lots of free drinks service from the waitresses if you stayed at machines. We tried the buffet breakfast once and were stuffed for the rest of the day - great choice of food to cater for everyone.

The Luxor is located on the far end of the strip, in between Excalibur and Mandalay, with a monorail service to all three hotels. It was quite refreshing to be at the end of the strip as you didn't walk straight into the madness of Vegas as soon as you stepped out of the hotel lobby. Additionally, there's a designer clothes outlet further on up the road, which is walkable, although it took us around an hour and a half to get to and we're quick walkers!
reviews.title: Was disappointed with The Luxor...

likes.liked: — How it looked from the Outside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want somewhere different to eat, I can highly recommend the Peppermill opposite Circus Circus. HUGE helpings, great menu, and a really kitsch setting. It's also got a bar/lounge which is supposed to be good at night.
reviews.title: Just a place to sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My top tip for Vegas is to go and see the amazing fountains at the Belaggio. We saw them 5 times, and still wanted more. Go there, and you'll see what I mean!
reviews.title: fab hotel
overpriced
reviews.text: stayed at luxor for a week 23rd to 30 march, paid £100 a night, which i now think is expensive,stayed in pyramid rooms very basic for price,shower was too hot to have on full so had a trickle,plus awful smell every time we went back to room, used the steakhouse on are second night which was a very good meal, when we went to go back it was shut down !!!! , nice to be told ,there is lots of work going on there which we had no knowledge of beforehand, think we could have done better for the price but live and learn, beware of those guys as you check in offering cheap tickets to shows , its not all it seems so beware, we got stung for $40 dollars then found out it was a property show involved , very clever guys , enjoyed vegas and trips , but check the hotels ,
Stayed three days at the end of march which i believe is very busy time of the year so was generally hectic.

reviews.text: The communal areas of the hotel were very good but the beyond that it was bit shabby. Cleaning service left lot to be desired.

reviews.text: Noticed some empty tray outside the room next to our which was not removed for at least couple of days despite the cleaners having done their round.

reviews.title: Too many people
reviews.text: Overall not too bad but unlikely to stay there again

reviews.title: alittle disappointed........
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in the jacuzzi suite at Luxor. At nearly $200 per night I was expecting more. The room ceilings were water-stained, wall paper was curling, the door wouldn't close without an extra pull, the AC/heater switch was broke on both units. You never knew wheather the heat or AC was on until 4am when your room was 85 degrees. All just minor issues, but all combined made for a rather disappointing stay.

reviews.title: Should Stay At Least Once
reviews.text: Management did make a minor adustment on the bill though which was helpful. Jacuzzi and shower were nice and worked well. Great water pressure...just about knocks you over. Overall not bad...as long as you get a reasonable rate.

reviews.title: Honestly, A Great Deal
reviews.text: Having just completed a three night stay at the Luxor (my first), I felt compelled to write this review to comment on some of the other reviews I read on this site. First off, many of the complaints you see are valid, the lines to check in/out are long, sometimes to the extreme. You can by-pass some of the line by using the "One-Club Card" member line, information that we did not have at the time, but will know better in the future. We had a card already. Upon check-in, the clerk was helpful, but not overly friendly. He did upgrade us to a jacuzzi suite, but at a price ($50 per night). He was very considerate, though, in placing us in a room near the inclinator, as I have a bad ankle and was not up to alot of walking. The suite was rather small, but the jacuzzi large and deep, more than big enough for two and was worth the additional money. The room stayed very warm though, even though it was Feb, and the air conditioner made such a racket I had to turn it off several times to get any peace and quiet! We were on the 30th floor (the top), so perhaps the heat rises. We had a beautiful view of the mountain range, but not the strip, which was fine. The bathroom was very large, and I agree with other reviewers, the space could have been better used. The casino is large, but we had no trouble navigating after a few hours. Not the best selection of slots I've ever seen, but we made due. We took in Blue Man Group, an awesome show which I do recommend, and ate at the Luxor Steakhouse, also fabulous and worth the steep prices. In fact, all the food we ate at the Luxor, with the exception of the Pyramid Cafe, was very good, above average I would say, and we LOVED the buffet. The attractions level has some fun things to do, we especially enjoyed the Imax Theater. The location was good for us, as we had shows at NyNy, which is two hotels away, and also wanted to spend some time at Mandalay Bay (next door). I was disappointed in Mandalay Place, only go if you have lots of $$$. Two things that were negative - comp system is bad. After three whole days of gambling and spending in the hotel, we only got one meal comped, not much incentive NOT to take your gambling dollars elsewhere. However, unlike some previous reviews, I had no trouble getting drinks in the casino, although the cocktail waitresses were not especially friendly, they were plentiful and you didn't wait too long for your drink. And lastly, this hotel is PACKED with kids. If you are not a parent and don't enjoy spending alot of time dodging children, then you may not like this hotel. I couldn't for the life of me figure out why SO many children would be at a hotel in Vegas in the middle of the week in the middle of the school year. Unbelievable! Cannot comment on the Spa, as we did not have time to go, but will say the pools are lovely, and even though we didn't swim, we did walk out there and chill for a while, and they are very nicely kept, clean and sparkly, and the veiw from out there is just gorgeous. Overall, this is a nice hotel, very beautiful in design both inside and out, but with some flaws. Do try it once, but we probably wouldn't stay again unless the rate was very, very low, mostly because we only get to Vegas every few years and want to try ALL the hotels.

I stayed at the Luxor recently and was pleasantly surprised, especially after seeing some recent bad reviews here. I had already booked the stay so I went ahead with it.
reviews.title: Was actually impressed

reviews.text: When I first got there, I had heard already to use the North Entrance since I was staying in a Tower room. Good advice. I pulled up to Valet and they couldn't have been nice and more polite. I had to come and go a lot during my stay and each person at valet was very polite and cordial.

reviews.title: Will stay somewhere else next time

likes.liked: — The relative quiet of the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to my room (you need to put your key into the slot in the elevator to get to your floor) and either Tower rooms are that much nicer or I had a recently upgraded room as the room was tremendous. Very nice sized with a big bathroom (including separate bath and shower). Nice sized desk with chair on one side and on the other a table with two nice chairs next to it. Big bed and huge armoire (or whatever you call it) with the TV. The TV was smallish but got the job done, I suppose. The armoire had closet type space on both sides that opened up to a lit area and one side had nice bathrobes for us to use. Everything was nice about the room, including the furniture. Not sure if all the Tower rooms are this nice, but it sounds like you definitely want to pay the extra few bucks to get one over a pyramid room. No mini-bars in the rooms, in case you care, and no safes.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.text: The Luxor was also surprisingly nice in the casino and their newer nightclubs (Cathouse and LAX) were very popular, although I did not go into either. I didn't eat much there other than a couple trips to the food court. They're doing some remodeling in the casino but I didn't find it too distracting.
reviews.title: Nothing much wrong with the Luxor

reviews.text: We were looking forward to the Vegas experience and the Luxor did not disappoint. As opposed to some of the other reviewers' experiences we checked in smoothly and found the self-parking signs easy to follow. We were in the Pyramid and found the room spacious, clean and quiet. The theming was really effective and we thought the Luxor had a nicer feel than other hotels we visited e.g. Excalibur and MGM. If you want a fabulous Vegas experience take in Cirque de Soleil's KA at the MGM: guaranteed to blow you away! And one tip - it can take up to 20 minutes just to leave your hotel, so put on your walking shoes.
reviews.title: Not disappointed by the Luxor

likes.disliked: — A little impersonal but you have to expect that in a hotel so huge

reviews.title: Wow!
reviews.text: Just got back from a week in Vegas and had the best holiday ever! From the moment you enter the Lobby you are taken in... It is amazing! There are 4/5 outdoor pools with waitress service so you can totally relax by the pool. The luxor has its own food court with many fast food places and also some lovely restaurants. The Luxor has everything you could possibly need. We went to see Carrot Top whilst we were staying here, this was actually in the Luxor.. What can I say... The guy is sooooo funny! I dont think ive ever laughed that much... well worth a visit!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will definately go back to Vegas and Definately stay in the Luxor... It was a fabulous hotel and i would recommend it to anyone! Fantastic!!
reviews.title: Luxor - slightly disappointing!
Egypt in Vegas!
reviews.text: We stopped at The Luxor in July 2005 during Nevadas major heatwave. We actually stopped in the pyramid which in itself is awe inspiring but unfortunately the room was shabby, there were stains and holes in the carpet and although the bedlinen was obviously freshly laundered it had all seen better days. The room also stank of stale cigarette smoke and unfortunately due to the structure of the pyramid there are no windows that you can open. Other than these small niggles with the room all the bars and restaurants situated within the hotel were very good, though we did find the waitresses slightly over zealous in the Pyramid Cafe. All in all the holiday was very enjoyable and i wouldn't be put off from stopping at The Luxor again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very large hotel but efficiently run with some helpful and friendly staff. A very large, clean room with good room service. The check in did take 25 minutes but we were supplied with bottles of water! Good breakfast, at a reasonable price, available in the hotel.
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.text: Just got back from our first visit to Las Vegas, Staying at the Luxor.
reviews.title: Luxor is Fantastic

reviews.text: We had a room on the 17th floor with a great view of Excalibur. The room was large, the air con perfect as the temperature outside was a warm 108, the hotel is gigantic, nothing prepares you for the sheer scale of it, it blows you away.
reviews.title: Large clean room
Great Choice
reviews.text: We expected a large queue for check in, and large it was, but the efficient staff got to us in only 15 minuets and we were given great directions to our room, which we found in no time at all, one great thing was the staff handed out water to people queueing to check in, which was well needed.
Beds are firm and very comfortable as were the pillows, your in Vegas so your not going to be spending much time in your room, but ours was very comfortable.
reviews.title: You whiners are CRAZY!!!!!
Not impressed at all
reviews.text: One thing to note is that the rooms have no safes so you have to go down to reception if you want any valuables looked after.

reviews.title: an amazing place!
reviews.text: Photos do not do Vegas justice, or indeed our hotel, it was awesome.

reviews.title: Stayed in the pyramid
reviews.text: Check in was so easy and quick, given choice of pyramid or tower rooms, we took tower room and were delighted, lovely spacious room with large bathroom with bath and shower, very clean, much more than we could have hoped for. Staff very helpful, only wee fault, cocktail girls in casino were not as friendly as other hotels. We only had buffet twice, but could not fault it, with plenty of choice and lovely hot meals. We found that being further down the strip was an advantage. We enjoyed walking everywhere and seeing every hotel as we walked past it - not advisable if you are not able to walk any distance . Would stay in the Luxor again for sure.

reviews.title: Great hotel, poor location
reviews.text: There are so many great hotels to stay at in Vegas that I want to try each one. High on my list was a few nights in a Pyramid room at the Luxor. We stayed there 4 nights in February. Since we arrived on a Saturday, they were quite full but we were able to get a pyramid room on the second floor - not quite the view I wanted but glad to experience the 'slanted' windows. We looked out over the front taxi area wich was fine - two doors away from an elevator that dropped us right behind the front desk area so it was very close to taxis and the strip. The room was very clean and tidied up nicely each night. Bed was comfortable and bathroom seemed quite new.

reviews.title: Fantastic Awesome
reviews.text: Since we were flying out on the last day at 11pm, I asked for a half day for the last day. I had to call the front desk the day before our departure and they agreed to it - check out at 6pm for a half price night. It was a good deal for us. All employees we met there were friendly and helpful.

reviews.title: Great for the most part- don't let the bad discourage you
reviews.text: As most of you know the Luxor is south of most of the hot spots on the strip but the Mandalay Bay resorts (Excalibur, Luxor and Manadaly Bay) have quite a bit of shopping, restaurants, etc to keep one busy. There is a monorail that runs between the 3 resorts. We always walked from the Luxor through the Excalibur (a bit of a maze) and cross the pedestrian bridge to NYNY as kind of an easy way to get further up on the strip.

aka: Luxor Las Vegas Hotel Las Vegas
